instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1932: What is A1932? A1932 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2018, 2019 with EMC 3184, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01521..
definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP5V_S5_LDO: What is PP5V_S5_LDO? PP5V_S5_LDO is a 5v rail present when the machine is in a S5 soft off state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Looks like there was little spillage around <TRANSISTOR>Q7660</TRANSISTOR>. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> goes between 12.2 and 12.6v. Current starts at .100ma then works to 400ma for a second then drops back to 100ma. Nothing visibly getting warm except t2 which is at around 40c.
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> is present.
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL> = 5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
L7670 reads .09 on diode instead of .42 haven't managed to solve.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Overvoltage through <TRANSISTOR>Q7660</TRANSISTOR> damaged something on the <SIGNAL>5V_G3S</SIGNAL> power rail.
Inject 5V there and check with IR camera if any components gets few degrees more than the others connected to the same rail.
You may need to wait several minutes, hoping this may help.
Resistance to ground is not too low, dificult to find the culprit; unless something enters into thermal avalanche.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Hi thanks for your help, only thing that stands out is around <CHIP>U2120</CHIP> ,the 4 resistors feeding it get to 30c with 5v injected at L7670. Strange thing is boardview shows the ic but pdf file will not find it. Is there a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A version of schematic?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: I found was what dragging down the diode reading for l7670 (<CHIP>U8110</CHIP>) replaced but now cycles between 50ma and 100ma 20v (stays at .50ma with  battery) . Tried restore and revive dfu but they error out at the end with "gave up waiting for device to transition 0xFCA). Will continue to troubleshoot. Any ideas welcomed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
I made some progress. I changed <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> now getting 100ma then goes to 900ma then cycles back down to 100ma . If I leave it then it starts charging the battery and goes to 2 amps. Another short somewhere ?.

Inspecting audio board now, again thanks for you input its greatly appreciated.
